column2: This APB peripheral primarily controls I/O configuration and I/O function connection.
It also supports a few registers for miscellaneous functions.
I/O configuration is a series of bits that control driver characteristics, such as drive strength and slew rate.
I/O function selection controls the select field of a mux that connects the I/O to different signals in the device.

column7: Number of IO connected to GPIO controller
Number of IO on device (not necessarily on package)
Number of bits in pad mux select, which means there are 2^NBIT_PADMUX options
Enable events from efpga to SOC
Enable SOC memory mapped access to EFPGA
Enable EFPGA access via TCDM port 3
Enable EFPGA access via TCDM port 2
Enable EFPGA access via TCDM port 1
Enable EFPGA access via TCDM port 0
EFPGA control  bits use per eFPGA design
